org.simplity.kernel.data

Class SingleRowSheet

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.simplity.kernel.data.SingleRowSheet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<FieldsInterface>, DataSheet, FieldsInterface

    public class SingleRowSheet
extends Object
implements DataSheet
    represents a sheet with exactly one row of data. Use this if list of columns is generally known at the time of creating the sheet, and the order is important. If you expect frequent add/remove columns, look at DynamicSheet instead
    Author:
    simplity.org

    • Constructor Summary

      create a sheet that does not have fixed fields.

        public String[][] getRawData()
        Description copied from interface: DataSheet
        get a simple rows-and-columns data structure with all values as text. boolean is translated to 1/0. date is translated as milliseconds
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        array of rows, with the header row containing column names

      • addColumn

        public void addColumn(String columnName,
                      ValueType valueType,
                      Value[] values)
        Description copied from interface: DataSheet
        add a column of values to this sheet. If column is already present, we update its values. This is an expensive operation, as we may have to extend arrays. Use with caution.
        Specified by:
        addColumn in interface DataSheet
        Parameters:
        columnName - columnName
        valueType - columnType
        values - optional. if non-null, its length MUST match the number of rows in the data sheet
